Concealed carry as a public trust: This metaphor frames gun ownership as a privilege entrusted to individuals for the common good, emphasizing the responsibility that comes with carrying a firearm.

Concealed carry as a societal pressure gauge: This metaphor suggests that the prevalence of concealed carry reflects underlying anxieties and fears within a community, potentially pointing to deeper social issues.
